page.title: 01ANGMERING AREA
page.content:
To the north of this area the land is rolling chalk downs reaching 99m above sea level and sloping gently southwards towards a flat coastal clay plain, south of the A27 trunk road. The downland consists of many scenic clay valleys with dispersed settlements, mainly farm cottages. Most people live on the coastal plain. This area is 50% mixed woodland and 50% farmland. The land is owned by the 17th Duke of Norfolk and the daughters of the 16th Duke.
The farming is mixed with wheat, barley, rape seed, oaks, linseed, dairy products and mushroom growing. The A27 cuts across the southern part. The area includes the north part of Angmering and Poling village. There are 3 disused chalk pits in this area.
